newsitem.title: USA: Senator calls for U.S. aid suspension to Palestinians.
newsitem.headline: Senator calls for U.S. aid suspension to Palestinians.

text.p: A Republican senator on Monday called for suspension of U.S. aid to the Palestinian authority until determination of whether an indirect "green light" was given for last week's suicide bomb in Tel Aviv.

"I would appreciate your advice, as promptly as possible, on your Department's conclusion as to whether Chairman (Yasser) Arafat and the Palestinian authority gave an indirect green light to the terrorists," Sen. Arlen Specter of Pennsylvania said in a letter to Secretary of State Madeleine Albright.

He also asked Albright to advise him on whether there was any U.S. aid in the pipeline which had not yet been turned over to the Palestinian authority. "If so, I request that such payments be withheld until the determination as to whether the Palestinian authority is complying" with its commitments under its peace accords with Israel.

A suicide bomber killed three women in a Tel Aviv cafe on Friday. The Islamic group Hamas threatened more suicide bombings if Israel pressed ahead with the construction of a Jewish settlement in Arab East Jerusalem.
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has blamed Arafat for giving Islamic militants a "green light" to launch attacks against the Jewish state. Arafat denies the charge.
